metadata.title: CVE-2016-7142 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The m_sasl module in InspIRCd before 2.0.23, when used with a service that supports SASL_EXTERNAL authentication, allows remote attackers to spoof certificate fingerprints and consequently log in as another user via a crafted SASL message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-7142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

inspircd - 2.0.23-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: inspircd package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.23-1').
